author: Prakash Kamat
text:
Accusing Tourism Minister Dilip Parulekar of going back on his assurances over demands by lifeguards of the Drishti Lifesaving Services during their recent withdrawal of an indefinite hunger stir, the All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC) in Goa on Monday said the employees would go on strike “one Saturday every month” till the demands were met.

Speaking to presspersons here, Goa AITUC General Secretary Christopher Fonseca said the assurances pertaining to service conditions and salaries of lifeguards were not fulfilled. Alleging “harassment, victimisation and unfair labour practices” by the Tourism Department and its contractor, Drishti Lifesaving Pvt. Ltd., Mr. Fonseca recalled that hundreds of lifeguards and those employed in allied services held a 15-day “satyagraha” from December 13 to 29 last year.
title: Goa lifeguards threaten stir ‘once a month’
